children.name: close
children.definition: /shutA2 to become shut: đónglại
examples: He walked out and the door shut behind him.
There was a bang as the gates shut.
Her eyes closed, and she fell into a deep sleep.

children.name: slam
children.definition: alsoslam shut if a doorslamsorslams shut, it shuts quickly and makes a loud noise: đóng sập lại
examples: ▪ Outside in the street, car doors slammed and people were shouting.
▪ She heard a door slam shut and the sound of footsteps on the path.

children.name: slide shut
children.definition: slide/blow/swing etc shut if a door, window, gate etc slides, blows, swings etc shut, it shuts by sliding, being blown, swinging etc: tự đóng lại do lung lay
examples: The window suddenly blew shut, with a loud bang.
The elevator doors silently slid shut.

children.name: to close an area, entrance or opening
close off
children.definition: to put sth across the entrance of a place to stop people from entering
examples: Police quickly closed off the area.

children.name: block up
children.definition: to put sth into a hole or entrance so that it is permanently closed: khóa lại , đóng lại, bịt lại, che lại

children.name: ▪ Martha tried to block the mouse holes up, but new ones kept appearing
examples: ▪ Some of the windows in the church had been blocked up.
▪ He blocked up the entrance to the tunnel with stones.

children.name: plug
children.definition: to fill a hole with a piece of suitable material in order to stop a liquid from getting through: bịt lại
examples: We tried to plug the hole in the bottom of the boat with a plastic bag.
Have you plugged that leak(= stopped it by filling the hole)in the pipe?
My nose was bleeding and I plugged it with cotton wool.

children.name: plug up
examples: They didn’t have enough material to plug up the gaps around the pipe.

children.name: seal
children.definition: 1(also up) to close an entrance or a container with something that stops air, water etc from coming in or out of it: đóng kín, bịt kín, gắn xi
examples: The window was sealed shut.

children.name: seal a joint/crack/opening/gap
examples: A quick way to seal awkward gaps is to use a foam filler.
Dried milk is kept inhermetically sealed(= very tightly closed )containers.

children.name: 2to close an envelope, package etc by using sth sticky to hold its edges in place : đóng kín,niêm phong
examples: He wrote the address and sealed the envelope.
Seal the package (up) with sticky tape.
He sealed (down) the envelope and put a stamp on it.

children.name: seal off
children.definition: to prevent people from entering an area or building, often because it is dangerous: cô lập,phong tỏa,niêm phong
examples: Two more bombs have been discovered since the police sealed off the area.

children.name: block off
children.definition: to close a road, path, or entrance so that people cannot use it: phong tỏa, cô lập
examples: All the roads out of the town had been blocked off by the police.
Police blocked off the city centre streets.
The fireplace had been blocked off.

children.name: to close a container: bottle, can, jar, etc
close
children.definition: shut/A2  to close a container, such as a box, case, or bottle: đóng lại
examples: ▪ As the teacher appeared, Matt shut the box quickly.
▪ Russell shut his briefcase with a snap, and the meeting was over.
▪ Put lids on all the jars and close them tightly.

children.name: put the lid on
children.definition: to shut a container such as a bottle or box by putting a lid onto it: đóng nắp
examples: ▪ Put the lid on the cookie jar when you’ve finished with it!
▪ If you leave cooked food in a pan, you should always put the lid on.

children.name: screw on
children.definition: to shut a container such as a bottle by putting the lid on and turning it round and round until it cannot be turned any more: đóng nắp chặt

children.name: screw on something: đóng nắp chặt lại
examples: ▪ I screwed on the top of the bottle as tightly as I could.

children.name: screw something back on: đóng chặt lại trên cái gì
examples: ▪ The fuel tank cap hadn’t been screwed back on properly, and it came off when I drove away.

children.name: screw something on: đóng nắp chặt lại
examples: ▪ She screwed the lid of the jar on again.

children.name: open
children.definition: mở ra( cửa)
examples: ▪ The train doors open and close automatically.
▪ The door slowly opened and a small boy entered the room.
▪ After a short discussion with the customs officers, the gates opened and the truck moved off.

children.name: burst open
children.definition: burst/fly open to open very suddenly - used especially in stories or descriptions: mở tung ra
examples: ▪ Before Mr Carey could speak, the door burst open and Mr Watson rushed into the room.
▪ Every time we go round a corner, the passenger door flies open.

children.name: to close a door, window, box etc
shut
children.definition: to move a door, window, gate etc so that it is no longer open: đóng lại
examples: ▪ Come in and shut the door behind you.
▪ Someone had shut the gate to stop the sheep getting out onto the road.
▪ She heard Charlotte downstairs shutting the windows, and locking up for the night.

children.name: close
children.definition: to shut something,especially in a careful way: đóng lại
examples: ▪ Do you mind if I close the window?
▪ She took the necklace out of the box and closed the lid.

children.name: slam
children.definition: to shut a door quickly so that it makes a loud noise, especially because you are angry: đóng sập cửa
examples: ▪ Jane marched out of the room slamming the door behind her.
▪ He slammed the door so hard that the glass cracked.

children.name: push sth shut
children.definition: push/kick/slide etc something shut  to push, kick, slide etc something so that it shuts: đẩy sập cái gì
examples: ▪ The woman pushed the door shut with her foot.
▪ It started raining, so I quickly pulled the window shut.
▪ ‘Sorry, we’re closed,’ said the official, sliding the wooden panel shut.

children.name: push the door to U
children.definition: pull/push the door to to move a door so that it is almost shut: đẩy cửa lại, khép cửa lại
examples: ▪ ‘Tell me what’s wrong,’ I said, pulling the door to.
▪ She pushed the door to against the blinding sunlight.

children.name: draw the curtains
children.definition: /close the curtains  to close curtains by pulling them across a window: đóng màn, khép màn
examples: ▪ Let’s draw the curtains. We don’t want people looking in.
▪ The curtains were closed and the room was in darkness.

children.name: to open a door, window, box etc
open
children.definition: mở
examples: ▪ It’s very hot in here. Do you mind if I open the window
▪ The drawer’s locked - you need a key to open it.
open something wide
▪ He opened the door wide, and gestured for me to come in.
open upspoken use this to tell someone to open a door:: mở ra
▪ Open up - it’s the police

children.name: unlock
children.definition: to turn the a key in the lock on a door, drawer, cupboard etc so that you can open it: mở khóa
examples: ▪ Unlock the door! We can’t get out!
▪ Which of these keys unlocks the safe?
▪ ‘Come and see’, Jo said, unlocking a huge iron gate.

children.name: force open
children.definition: to open a drawer, window, cupboard etc by using force, often with a tool: phá cửa

children.name: force sth/it open
examples: ▪ The door’s stuck - we’ll have to force it open.

children.name: force open sth
examples: ▪ The burglars had forced open the window with an iron bar.
▪ It looked as though the shed had been forced open.

children.name: break down U
children.definition: break down to completely break a locked door in order to get into a room or building: đập vỡ , đập tan
examples: ▪ Firemen had to break the door down.
▪ Open the door now or we’ll break it down!

children.name: wind down
children.definition: /roll downUK  to open a car window, especially by turning a handle: hạ ( cửa sổ xe hơi )
examples: ▪ The driver wound down his window and asked us the way to the stadium.
▪ Mom, will you roll your window down a little please?

children.name: prise open
children.definition: UK /pryopenUS  to open sth by forcing one part of it away from the other part, using a tool: mở
examples: ▪ All the flats were boarded up, but we managed to prise a few boards open.
▪ Laura leaned forward to pry open the crate.

children.name: prise the lid offremove the lid to open it: mở
examples: ▪ I picked up the coffee tin and, using a knife, prised the lid off.

children.name: try U
children.definition: try  to try to open a door or window in order to see if it is locked: cố gắng mở khóa
examples: ▪ I knocked, then tried the door. It was open, but the room was empty.
▪ I went around the back to try the windows, but they were all locked.

children.name: to close your eyes or mouth
close
children.definition: to close your eyes or mouth: đóng
examples: ▪ I lay down and closed my eyes.
▪ Lara opened her mouth to speak, then closed it again.

children.name: shut
children.definition: to close your eyes or mouth: đóng
examples: ▪ He shut his eyes and listened to the music.

children.name: to open a packet or sth that is folded or rolled
open
children.definition: mở(
examples: ▪ Aren’t you going to open your letter?
Bạn đang mở thư hả?
▪ Judy opened another pack of cigarettes.

children.name: Judy mở một hộp thuốc lá khác
examples: ▪ When I received the parcel, it had already been opened.

children.name: Khi tôi nhận được cái bưu kiện, nó đã mở rồi
unwrap
children.definition: to open a package by removing the paper that is wrapped around it:
examples: ▪ I just love unwrapping Christmas presents!
▪ Sarah sat down and unwrapped her sandwiches.

children.name: unfold
children.definition: to open something that was folded, such as a piece of paper or cloth:
examples: ▪ They unfolded the tablecloth and set out the picnic.
▪ The receipt had been folded and unfolded so many times that it was almost in pieces.

children.name: unroll
children.definition: to spread out something that was rolled up, so that it lies flat:
examples: ▪ He unrolled the map and spread it on the table.
▪ While we were admiring the rugs, the shopkeeper started to unroll a splendid carpet.

children.name: unwind
children.definition: to undo sth that has been wrapped around sth else, or to become undone after being wrapped around sth: tháo ra, gỡ ra
examples: She started to unwind her scarf.
In a nearby medical tent, aUSArmy doctor gently unwinds Metruk's bandage.

children.name: to open a container: bottle, can, jar, etc
open
children.definition: to open a bottle, box, or other container by removing or lifting its top or lid: mở( chai, hộp)
examples: ▪ Ask the waiter to open another bottle of champagne.

children.name: ▪ a little gadget that helps you to open jars
unscrew
children.definition: to remove the top or lid of a bottle or container by turning it: vặn, tháo ( lắp chai lọ )
examples: ▪ Robyn unscrewed a jar of moisturiser and smoothed it over her face.
▪ Pills are stored in containers with tops that are difficult for children to unscrew.

children.name: crack open
children.definition: to open a bottle of alcohol: mở, khui
examples: ▪ Let’s crack open a bottle of champagne.
▪ We cracked a few cans of beer open and sat down to watch the game.

children.name: uncork
children.definition: to open a bottle of wine by removing the cork. The cork is a piece of wood which is put in the top of the bottle: mở nút, tháo nút bần
examples: Ray uncorked the bottle and offered me a glass of wine.

children.name: to open your eyes or mouth
open
children.definition: your eyes/mouth mở mắt/ miệng
examples: She opened her eyes and sat up in bed.

children.name: open (your mouth) wide
examples: The dentist told me to open my mouth a little wider.
Open wide. I need to look at the back of your throat.
